* Main controller class for Jellicent application.

*

This class acts as the central coordinator between the GUI, task storage, task management and command parsing.

*
  • Loading saved tasks from the storage file on initialization.

*
  • Parsing user input into commands using {@link Parser}.
*     li>Executing commands to modify tasks, update storage, and produce

*

Jellicent does not handle direct UI rendering or file storage itself;
* it delegates these responsibilities to {@link Ui} and {@link Storage}.
* This class is intended to be used by the GUI layer to process user input
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* @param input String input from user interface.
* @return CommandResponse associated with type of input.
assert input != null : "Input should not be null";

* Represents an abstract command that can be executed in the Jellicent application.
* A {@code Command} defines the structure for all concrete commands, including
* execution logic via {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)} and identifying
* {@link MarkCommand}) should extend this class and implement the abstract methods.
*     Command cmd = new TodoCommand("Read a book");
* Executes the relevant commands and returns the relevant string display message.
* @param tasklist The lists of tasks used in the program.
* @param storage Main object used in the program.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents the response of executing a command.
* A {@code CommandResponse} contains a message to be displayed to the user
* and the {@link CommandType} of the command that generated this response.
*     CommandResponse response = new CommandResponse("Task added successfully", CommandType.TODO);
public record CommandResponse(String message, CommandType type) {}
* Represents the types of commands available in the Jellicent application.
* Each {@code CommandType} corresponds to a specific command that can be executed,
* such as listing tasks, adding tasks, marking tasks as done/undone, or finding tasks.

*
  • {@link #UNMARK} - Mark a task as not done

*
  • {@link #ERROR} - Represents an invalid or unrecognized command

* Provides parsing utilities for the Jellicent application.
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for converting raw input strings
* or saved file data into {@link Task} objects or {@link Command} objects
* that the application can execute. It also handles validation and throws
* {@link ParserException} for invalid formats or missing information.

*
  • Converting stored file strings into a {@link TaskList} via {@link #stringsIntoTasks(ArrayList)}

*
  • Converting user input strings into executable {@link Command} objects via {@link #userInputIntoCommand(String)}

*
  • Parsing and validating date/time strings for tasks

*
  • Providing informative error messages when input is invalid or incomplete
*     Command command = Parser.userInputIntoCommand("todo Read a book");
private static final Map<CommandType, String> ARG_REQUIRED_ERROR = Map.of(
CommandType.MARK, "OOPS! Mark command requires an integer after",
CommandType.UNMARK, "OOPS! Unmark command requires an integer after",
CommandType.DELETE, "OOPS! Delete command requires an integer after",
CommandType.TODO, "OOPS! The description of a todo cannot be empty.",
CommandType.EVENT, "OOPS! An event requires a description, /from and /to timeframe!",
CommandType.DEADLINE,"OOPS! A deadline requires a description and /by deadline!",
CommandType.FIND, "OOPS! Find command requires a search word!"
* @param strings ArrayList of tasks' data from saved file.
* @return Initialised TaskList at the start of program.
* @throws ParserException for incorrect text format from file and task types from text file

* implement the {@link #toFileString()} method for file persistence.
